In groepen onder leiding van een groot varken steken ze vaak in de romp van een klein schip, laten het zinken en verslinden de bemanning.

monster.name: Sentinel In Darkness
languages: Understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Scourge of the Seekers
entries: De schildwacht heeft voordeel op aanvalsrollen tegen wezens met donkerzicht, blindzicht, of waarneming.

trait.name: Vault Keeper
entries: Geheime deuren en illusoire muren binnen 1.500 voet van de schildwacht hebben de DC om hun aanwezigheid te detecteren verhoogd met 5.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: De wachter doet twee aanvallen met stenen vuisten. Als beide aanvallen een Large of kleiner wezen raken, moet het doelwit slagen op een {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw of één voorwerp verliezen dat geen wapen is en dat klein genoeg is om in één hand te passen. Het voorwerp wordt geteleporteerd naar een willekeurige onbezette ruimte binnen 200 meter van de wachter. Het doelwit voelt een mentale ruk in de algemene richting van het voorwerp tot het wordt teruggevonden.

action.name: Stone Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} om te raken, reikwijdte 10 ft., één doel. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) knuppelschade.

action.name: Curse of the Wanderer {@recharge 6}
entries: Een wezen dat de wachter kan zien binnen een straal van 30 meter moet slagen op een {@dc 15} Wijsheidsparende worp of hij ondergaat de Vloek van de Wanderer. Tijdens de vervloeking wordt de snelheid van het wezen gehalveerd en kan het zijn hp niet herwinnen. Voor elke 24 uur dat hij geen nieuwe informatie ontdekt of leert, loopt hij 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychische schade op. De vloek blijft bestaan totdat hij wordt opgeheven door een {@spell remove curse} spreuk of soortgelijke magie.

{@i A blindfolded, stone face leers down from beneath a hooded cloak stitched from thousands of desiccated treasure maps. With each step the four-armed, stone figure takes, torches sputter, compasses spin, and ink fades.}

entries.name: Protector of Secrets
entries: Schildwachten in de duisternis zijn magische constructies die tot taak hebben geheime gewelven en relikwieën te bewaken. Deze wezens schrikken plunderaars af met hun imposante vorm, hun brute kracht en hun magische aard die geheimen verbergt. Er wordt gezegd dat wanneer een schildwacht wordt gedood, zijn mantel van kaarten wegbrandt, met achterlating van één kaart naar een grote, geheime schat.

entries.name: Magical Theft
entries: Schildwachten in de duisternis kunnen een begeerd voorwerp weg toveren, terwijl ze ontdekkingsreizigers vervloeken met een onuitblusbaar verlangen om geheimen te vinden - zelfs ten koste van de gezondheid van de ontdekkingsreiziger zelf.

entries.name: Awakening the Sentinel
entries: Om een schildwacht in de duisternis tot leven te wekken, moet de schepper een inerte stenen golem doordrenken met de geest van een sterveling die gestorven is nadat hij ten minste één vreselijk geheim mee het graf in had genomen.

entries.name: Construct Nature
entries: Een schildwacht in duisternis heeft geen lucht, eten, drinken of slaap nodig.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: De serpentfolk heeft voordeel op saving throws tegen spreuken en andere magische effecten.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: De serpentfolk voert twee aanvallen uit, één met zijn beet en één met zijn kromzwaard.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één schepsel. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) doorborende schade plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) gifschade.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doel. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slagen schade.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} om te raken, afstand 80/320 ft., één doel. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) doorborende schade.

{@i The hooded cultist utters a sibilant phrase. Then, like a fading mask of fog, his face suddenly vanishes and in its stead leers a monstrous serpent's head. His terrible, slit eyes blaze unblinkingly as his scaly hands twist and contort in arcane gestures.}

entries.name: Priests of the Serpent God
entries: Grimmige verhalen doen de ronde over een prehistorisch ras van boosaardige slangenmensen die, onder het mom van een menselijke cultus, heimelijk een monsterlijke religie hebben opgebouwd rond de verering van de slangengod Yig. Zoals een acteur een masker draagt, gebruiken deze duivelse mensachtigen illusoire magie om iedereen te imiteren die zij willen. Deze vermomming wordt echter vaak verraden door de aanwezigheid van de angstaanjagende, vieze geur van de serpentfolk

entries.name: Under Cloak of Blasphemy
entries: Serpentfolk van Yig vertrouwen op hun natuurlijke sluwheid en de tovenarij van hun koude, reptielachtige bloedlijn om te overleven. Deze slangenmensen leven in het geheim tussen de steden van de beschaafde naties en beramen plannen om de warmbloedige erfgenamen van de wereld omver te werpen "wanneer de sterren juist staan". Bekend als "zij die de nacht bewandelen", leven de serpentfolk van Yig om de afschuwelijke, kwaadaardige agenda van hun duistere god te dienen. Velen willen krachtige tovenaars en meestermoordenaars worden om het doel van hun wrede leven beter te dienen. De Koningin der Serpenten (zie blz. 34) beschouwt de serpentfolk als gruwelen, corrupte versies van echte slangen, en er heerst grote vijandschap tussen haar volgelingen en de volgelingen van Yig.

entries.name: The Snake That Speaks
entries: In weerwil van de scheppingsmythes rond de Wereldslang Veles, aanbidden de serpentfolk hun Grote Oude voorvader als de ware Vader der Serpenten, en kennen hem onder vele namen - onder andere Set, Quetzelcoatl en Ningishzida. Terwijl hun verraderlijke culten in omvang toenemen - gezwollen met geallieerde gruwelen zoals de Dienaren van Yig, de {@creature scitalis|CCodex}, en andere reptielachtige gedrochten - bewegen de serpentfolk zich steeds verder van hun schaduwrijke jungle enclaves om de goedgelovige koninkrijken van de mens te corrumperen.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: De aangeboren tovervaardigheid van de serpentfolk of yig is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). Hij kan de volgende spreuken aangeboren bezweringen doen, waarvoor geen materiële componenten nodig zijn:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: De dienaar van Yig heeft voordeel bij het redden van worpen tegen spreuken en andere magische effecten.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: De dienaar van Yig doet twee aanvallen. een met zijn beet en een met zijn strijdbijl.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één schepsel. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) doorborende schade plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) gifschade. Het doelwit moet slagen op een {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw of {@condition poisoned} worden. Terwijl {@condition poisoned} op deze manier, is het doelwit {@condition incapacitated} en neemt 7 ({@damage 2d6}) gifschade aan het begin van elk van zijn beurten. Het doelwit kan de worp herhalen aan het einde van elk van zijn beurten, en het effect op zichzelf beëindigen als hij slaagt.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} om te raken, reikwijdte 10 ft., één schepsel. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) snijschade.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één schepsel. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) knuppelschade, en het doelwit is {@condition grappled} (ontsnapping {@dc 14}). Totdat deze greep eindigt, is het schepsel {@condition restrained}, en de Dienaar van Yig kan geen ander doelwit insluiten.

{@i This massive ophidian is a hideous amalgam of man and snake—a fanged humanoid head with expressionless features sits atop the shimmering coils of a large, squamous body. As the creature hisses, its full lips open to speak in the rich, vibrant tone of an unknown tongue, forgotten long before the kingdoms of man arose.}

entries.name: Progeny of the Serpent God
entries: Dienaren van Yig zijn monsterlijke mensachtig-serpent hybriden die vaak dienen als schildwachten en moordenaars voor de vreselijke Oude Yig en zijn afschuwelijke volgelingen. De gevlekte, bruinachtige huid en de obscene stank van deze lange, geschubde wezens staan in contrast met de koude en buitenaardse schoonheid van hun emotieloze gelaat.

entries.name: Abhorrent Executioners
entries: Legenden spreken over een vloek die iedereen verdoemt die zo dom is Yig te verraden of zijn woede op te wekken. Degenen die door de Grote Oude zijn veroordeeld, krijgen inderdaad bezoek van deze verfoeilijke dienaren om aan een onaangenaam einde te komen. Als deze angstaanjagende wezens niet bezig zijn als meesterlijke heimelijke jagers, dienen zij als de behoorlijk gestoorde bewakers van duistere, verboden plaatsen.

entries.name: The Swollen Death
entries: De dienaren van Yig zijn de kinderen van de Oude en werden geschapen naar zijn afschuwelijk evenbeeld. Hun onheilige gif zorgt ervoor dat het lichaam van een schepsel dat door het gif wordt gedood, opzwelt tot het mollige vlees met een weerzinwekkende "pop" scheurt.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: De aangeboren tovervaardigheid van de dienaar van yig is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). Hij kan de volgende spreuken aangeboren bezweringen doen, waarvoor geen materiële componenten nodig zijn:

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: Terwijl de schaduwziekte onbeweeglijk blijft, is hij niet te onderscheiden van de stronk van een dode boom.

action.name: Frozen Shadow Tendril
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 5} om te raken, reikwijdte 10 ft., één doelwit. {@h} 7 ({@damage 2d6}) koude schade plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotische schade.

action.name: Animate Plants (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: De schaduwvloek bezielt op magische wijze {@dice 1d4} planten binnen een straal van 60 meter en verandert ze in {@creature awakened shrub|mm|awakened shrubs} planten die hij onder controle heeft. De aanvallen van deze planten veroorzaken een extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotische schade. Als de struiken niet voor 1 uur vernietigd zijn, worden het nieuwe schaduwplaagjes.
{@i The stump of a blackened, frostbitten conifer stands upright on six leg-like roots and scuttles sideways like an arboreal hermit crab. Inky shadows fill a hollow near the base of the stump.}

entries.name: Born of Vampires
entries: Wanneer een vampier een karmozijnrode mist wordt (zie blz. 67), vlucht de doodsbange, beestachtige essentie van de vampier aanvankelijk en verbergt hij zich terwijl hij probeert zijn zintuigen terug te krijgen. De mist schuilt in de schaduw van een hoge boom in de ijzige noordelijke laaglanden en verslindt boombewonende insecten en kleine dieren totdat hij sterk genoeg is om weer te jagen. De boom, verzwakt door de necrotische energie die van de versterkende karmozijnrode mist afkomt, bezwijkt vaak aan bevriezing, en animeert de volgende zonsondergang als een schaduwvloek.

entries.name: Spreading Parasite
entries: De schaduwvloek verlangt ernaar om de schaduw die hem bezielt te verspreiden naar andere dode bomen. Hij probeert ook een deur te vinden naar het Schaduwgebied, zodat hij voor altijd in de afgelegen duisternis kan bestaan. Hij is bereid iedereen af te slachten die hem verhindert zijn verlangens te bevredigen.

entries.name: Red Flowering
entries: Schaduwvlekken worden soms gekweekt door vampieren, liches of necromancers als bijzonder weerzinwekkende beschermers. Wanneer ze een levend wezen doden, gaan ze kort bloeien. Deze bloesems lijken op een rozige kornoelje of, in sommige klimaten, een bloeiende pruimenboom.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: De schaduw rivierheer kan zich door een ruimte bewegen zo smal als een duim breed zonder te persen.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: De shadow river lord doet twee greenfire staf of twee shadowfrost bolt aanvallen. Als twee aanvallen hetzelfde doelwit raken, moet het doelwit een {@dc 16} grondwettelijke reddingsworp doen of {@condition blinded} worden geraakt tot het einde van zijn volgende beurt.

action.name: Greenfire Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doelwit. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) knuppelschade plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) vuurschade.

action.name: Shadowfrost Bolt
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} om te raken, bereik 150 ft., één doelwit. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotische schade plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) koude schade.

action.name: Shadow Geyser {@recharge 6}
entries: De shadow river lord stoot een geiser van schimmig water uit zijn staf in een kegel van 30 voet. Elk wezen in dat gebied moet een Dexterity {@dc 16} reddingsworp doen en krijgt 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotische schade en 21 ({@damage 6d6}) koude schade als de reddingspoging mislukt, of half zoveel schade als de reddingspoging slaagt.

{@i The figure rising from the water appears to wear a cloak made of stars, but the moonlight reveals a watery garment of black liquid. The form beneath the water is as fluid as the cloak. A blue-white skull grins from atop the body, and the staff it holds glows with green fire.}

entries.name: Undead Fey Spirits
entries: Schaduw rivier heren maken hun huizen waar gevaarlijke rivieren de barrière wegslijten tussen de sterfelijke wereld en de donkere fey landen. Deze gevaarlijke wezens azen op hen die reizen of wonen in de buurt van de rivier. Een schepsel dat in de rivier sterft, verbeurt zijn ziel aan de plaatselijke schaduwrivierheer, die de ziel wegfluistert naar het feeënrijk om te worden gebruikt als betaalmiddel of als middel om meer macht te verkrijgen.

entries.name: Shadow Skeleton Servants
entries: Terwijl de zielen van de slachtoffers van een schaduwrivierheer verloren gaan, wordt het vlees verslonden door de bewoners van de rivier, waardoor alleen botten overblijven. Deze botten worden gereanimeerd als {@creature shadow skeleton|CCodex|shadow skeletons}, die op de loer liggen onder het oppervlak van de rivier, wachtend op de oproep van hun meester tot actie. De schaduwskeletten verbergen zich in stroomversnellingen of in de diepste delen van een rivier, in de hoop hun slachtoffers mee te sleuren naar een waterige ondergang.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: Een schaduw rivierheer heeft geen lucht, eten, drinken, of slaap nodig.

trait.name: Eldritch Sight
entries: Magische duisternis belemmert de Shantak's donkere zicht niet.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: De shantak lokt geen gelegenheidsaanval uit als hij buiten het bereik van een vijand vliegt.

trait.name: Keen Sight and Smell
entries: De shantak heeft voordeel bij Wijsheid ({@skill Perception}) controles die gebaseerd zijn op zicht of reuk.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: De shantak is in het voordeel bij reddingsacties tegen spreuken en andere magische effecten.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: De shantak heeft voordeel bij aanvalsrollen tegen een wezen als ten minste één van de bondgenoten van de shantak zich binnen 5 voet van het wezen bevindt en de bondgenoot niet {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Unctuous Hide
entries: De huid van een shantak is zeer glibberig. Een berijder kan van een shantak afstappen zonder dat dit ten koste gaat van de bewegingssnelheid. Als een effect de shantak tegen zijn wil verplaatst terwijl er een wezen op zit, moet het wezen slagen op een {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw of van de shantak vallen, waarbij het {@condition prone} in een ruimte binnen 5 voet van de shantak landt. Als een berijder {@condition prone} of {@condition unconscious} wordt geraakt terwijl hij op de shantak zit, moet hij eenzelfde sprong maken. Bovendien kan de shantak als bonusactie proberen een ruiter van zich af te schudden, waardoor de ruiter een reddingsworp moet doen om overeind te blijven.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: De shantak doet twee aanvallen. Een met zijn beet en een met zijn klauwen.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doelwit. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) doorborende schade plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotische schade.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doelwit. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) snijschade plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) necrotische schade.

action.name: Insane Tittering {@recharge 4}
entries: De shantak stoot een afschuwelijke gil uit. Elk niet shantak schepsel binnen 60 meter dat het kan horen moet slagen op een {@dc 15} grondwettelijke worp of {@condition frightened} worden tot het einde van de volgende beurt van de shantak. De shantak kan kiezen of hij zijn berijder bij deze actie betrekt of niet.

{@i A loathsome, horse-headed creature of elephantine bulk stretches its great slippery wings in malignant joy. The leering monstrosity calls out with tittering tones that rasp like the scratching of ground glass.}

entries.name: Nameless Sentinels
entries: De luidruchtige en nijlpaardachtige vogels die bekend staan als shantaks zijn het onderwerp van groteske legenden. Deze ongelooflijke, gevleugelde kolossen zijn afkomstig uit de legendarische Bergen van Leng, waar ze broeden tussen immense steengroeven en cyclopische steden van onyx.

entries.name: Hideous Mounts
entries: Shantaks dienen vaak als rijdieren en bedienden van arcane bezweerders en reizigers van de Leegte (zoals het interplanaire Volk van Leng). De rime en niter van de onderaardse putten klampen zich vast aan de enorme vleugels van deze weerzinwekkende beesten.

entries.name: Void Traveler
entries: De shantak heeft geen lucht, eten, drinken of omgevingsdruk nodig.

trait.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
entries: De zwerm is {@condition incapacitated} in de buurt van een antimagisch veld. Als de {@spell dispel magic} spreuk op de zwerm is gericht, moet deze slagen op een grondwettelijke worp tegen de DC van de spreuk van de caster of {@condition unconscious} vallen gedurende 1 minuut.

trait.name: Come Together (3/Day)
entries: Als de schervenzwerm minstens 1 hitpunt heeft en alle scherven zich binnen 30 voet van elkaar bevinden, kunnen de scherven zich als bonusactie opnieuw vormen in elke ruimte waarin zich minstens één van de scherven bevindt.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: Hoewel de zwerm onbeweeglijk blijft en niet vliegt, is hij niet te onderscheiden van een normale hoop troep.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: De zwerm kan de ruimte van een ander wezen innemen en omgekeerd, en de zwerm kan door elke opening bewegen die groot genoeg is voor een kiezelsteen. De zwerm kan geen hp herwinnen of tijdelijke hp krijgen.

action.name: Shards
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} om te raken, bereik 0 ft., één wezen in de ruimte van de zwerm. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) slagschade of 2 ({@damage 1d4}) slagschade als de zwerm de helft van zijn hp of minder heeft.

action.name: Shrapnel
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} om te raken, bereik 30 ft., één doel. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) doorborende schade. Een stuk van de zwerm breekt af en valt in de ruimte van het doelwit.

action.name: Contain {@recharge 5}
entries: De scherfzwerm omhult een medium of kleiner wezen in zijn ruimte. Het doelwit moet slagen op een {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw of {@condition restrained} gedurende 1 minuut in de zwerm blijven. Het doelwit heeft nadeel bij deze reddingsworp als de scherfzwerm Come Together heeft gebruikt om zich in de ruimte van het doelwit te vormen. Terwijl {@condition restrained}, neemt het doelwit geen schade van de Shards actie van de zwerm, maar het neemt 5 ({@damage 2d4}) slashing schade als het een actie neemt die beweging vereist, zoals aanvallen of het uitroepen van een spreuk met somatische componenten. Een wezen binnen 3 meter van de zwerm kan een actie ondernemen om een {@condition restrained} wezen uit de zwerm te trekken. Dit vereist een succesvolle {@dc 13} krachttest, en het wezen dat de poging onderneemt, loopt 5 ({@damage 2d4}) slagen schade op.

variant.name: Rubble Swarm
entries: Sommige constructies zijn geheel van steen en laten puin achter als ze worden vernietigd. Een puinzwerm heeft dezelfde statistieken als een scherfzwerm, behalve dat hij met zijn aanvallen vernietigende schade toebrengt.
{@i Broken pieces of metal, clay, and wood fly together in an erratic tornado.}
De meeste vuilnisbelten zijn uiterst vergeetbaar. Het afval moet letterlijk tot leven komen om blijvende herinneringen achter te laten... en littekens.

entries.name: Recycled Guardians
entries: Het proces om constructiewachters te maken vergt een investering van energie, goud en tijd. Wanneer een van deze wachters wordt vernietigd, tapt een zuinige spellcaster de overgebleven magie van de restjes af om een scherfzwerm te maken. De maker plaatst de zwerm strategisch zodat hij eruit ziet als een ongevaarlijke hoop rommel, zodat hij indringers kan verrassen.

entries.name: Surprise Cages
entries: De stukken van een scherfzwerm kunnen ver uit elkaar liggen en in een oogwenk samenkomen. Sommige scheppers gebruiken de zwermen als levende kooien, waarbij ze de scherven opdragen om indringers die niet willen meewerken, vast te houden tot de schepper een behoorlijke ondervraging heeft uitgevoerd.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: De oeverloper kan lucht en water inademen.

trait.name: Magnetic Shell
entries: Aan het begin van elke beurt van de kustlijnkrabber moet elk wezen binnen 5 meter van de krabber slagen op een {@dc 15} krachtsparingsworp of de metalen voorwerpen die het draagt of bij zich draagt blijven aan de schelp van de krabber kleven. Een schepsel dat van metaal is of een metalen pantser draagt dat niet slaagt voor de saving throw, blijft aan het schild kleven en {@condition restrained}. Als het voorwerp een wapen is en de drager kan of wil het wapen niet loslaten, dan zit de drager vast aan het omhulsel en is {@condition restrained}. Een vastzittend voorwerp kan niet worden gebruikt. Een wezen kan zijn actie uitvoeren om één wezen of voorwerp uit de schelp van de kustlijnkrabber te verwijderen door te slagen voor een {@dc 15} Strength-check.
Voorwerpen van goud en zilver worden niet beïnvloed door de Magneetschil van de kustlijnschraper. Als de strandjutter sterft, worden alle metalen wezens en voorwerpen vrijgelaten.

trait.name: Metal Sense
entries: De oeverkrabber kan op geur de plaats bepalen van metalen binnen 60 voet van hem.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: De kustlijnkrabber doet twee klauwaanvallen.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doel. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) snijschade.

action.name: Magnetic Pulse {@recharge 5}
entries: De oeverloper veroorzaakt een magnetische krachtstoot in zijn schelp. Elk wezen binnen een straal van 25 meter van de strandloper wordt onderworpen aan zijn magnetische schelp. Als je niet slaagt, worden metalen voorwerpen van het wezen of het wezen zelf, als het van metaal is of een metalen pantser draagt, tot 3 meter in de richting van de strandloper getrokken en blijven ze aan zijn schild kleven. Wezens die aan de schelp van de strandjutter kleven zijn {@condition restrained}.

reaction.name: Shell Protection
entries: De strandloper voegt 4 toe aan zijn AC tegen een aanval die hem zou kunnen raken als hij zich terugtrekt in zijn schild. Totdat hij tevoorschijn komt, verhoogt hij zijn AC met 4, heeft hij een snelheid van 0 ft. en kan hij zijn klauwen of magnetische puls niet gebruiken. De oeverloper kan als bonusactie uit zijn schelp tevoorschijn komen.
{@i This bulky crustacean generates a magnetic pulse that draws metal to its growing, shell-like shelter.}

entries.name: Metal Scavenger
entries: Een kustschraper zoekt instinctief metaal en verzamelt het met een magnetische puls. Het verzamelde metaal van het wezen vormt een draagbare schuilplaats die dienst doet als zijn schild.

entries.name: Hunted for Hoard
entries: A shoreline scrapper's hoard might include more than just rusty debris. As a result of scavenging a shipwreck or sunken city, its metal shell may contain valuables. For this reason, treasure seekers sometimes hunt shoreline scrappers. They hope to uncover riches from the creature's metal-hoard shell, but those foolish enough to engage a shoreline scrapper while equipped with metal rarely survive.

entries.name: Conditioned for War
entries: Some aquatic and coastal races train shoreline scrappers for combat. On command, shoreline scrappers charge toward enemies and disarm them of metal equipment. Deployed soldiers then enter the fray to annihilate their vulnerable enemies.

trait.name: Absorbent
entries: When the avatar damages a creature, it absorbs a portion of that creature's knowledge and power. As a bonus action, it can recreate any action available to a creature it damaged within the last minute. This includes spells and actions with limited uses or with a recharge. This recreated action is resolved using the avatar's statistics where applicable.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The avatar, including its equipment, can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the avatar fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Soothing Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to the avatar that starts its turn within 30 feet of the avatar must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn. Creatures with Intelligence 3 or lower automatically fail the saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The avatar makes three oozing tentacle attacks.

action.name: Oozing Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d12 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Legendary Merge
entries: A shoth with less than half its maximum hp can merge with any other shoth creature within 10 feet, adding its remaining hp to that creature's. The hp gained this way can exceed the normal maximum of that creature. The avatar can accept any number of such mergers.

action.name: Acid Wave {@recharge 5}
entries: The avatar rises up and crashes down, releasing a 20-foot radius wave of acidic ooze. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 67 ({@damage 15d8}) acid damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Consult the Zom (1/Day)
entries: The avatar uses its action to consult its weighty zom for insight. The zom flashes brilliant crimson-and-white light. Each creature within 120 feet who can see the avatar must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn. Each creature of the avatar's choice within 120 feet that speaks a language must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn as the avatar telepathically utters a short expression that is particularly meaningful to that creature.

legendary.name: At Will Spell
entries: The avatar casts one at will spell.

legendary.name: Oozing Tentacle
entries: The avatar makes one oozing tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Acid Wave (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The avatar uses Acid Wave, if it is available.

The avatar of Shoth is a gargantuan, oozing pile connected to two droths by viscous appendages. A massive pulsing zom sits in the center of its body, and it is from there that the laws and edicts of Shoth emanate. The avatar's zom is a powerful magical artifact, which stores, creates, and disseminates the rules and tenets of the shoth across the planes of existence. Through this zom, the avatar can communicate telepathically with any shoth over any distance and across any plane. The zom magically returns to Shoth if the avatar is slain.

entries.name: Abandon or Persist
entries: The avatar of Shoth is often called to worlds where the shoth have been unsuccessful in convincing a populace to dissolve with them. Though the shoth possess infinite patience, in certain circumstances Shoth determines it is no longer necessary to pursue a certain form of life. Alternatively, Shoth may decide to take extreme measures to encourage willingness to step into a zolv. On numerous occasions, Shoth has sent its avatar to destroy all other life on a world to force the reluctant race's hand.

entries.name: the Avatar of shoth's lair
entries: The Dripping Place is an enormous vessel that houses the avatar of Shoth itself. The massive ship is made from slime-exuding metal plates and is powered by mysterious, magical energy. The avatar pilots the ship from its central chamber. The Dripping Palace only arrives on worlds where the shoth have met extreme opposition. Wherever the palace goes, a force of oth paladins goes with it.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The avatar of shoth's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Absorbent (3/Day)
entries: When the droth damages a creature, it absorbs a portion of that creature's knowledge and power. As a bonus action, it can recreate any action available to a creature it damaged within the last minute. This includes spells and actions with limited uses or with a recharge. This recreated action is resolved using the droth's statistics where applicable.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The droth, including its equipment, can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Soothing Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to the droth that starts its turn within 20 feet of the droth must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn. Creatures with Intelligence 3 or lower automatically fail the saving throw.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The droth makes two oozing crush attacks.

action.name: Oozing Crush
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}30 ({@damage 4d12 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Merge
entries: A shoth with less than half its maximum hp can merge with any other shoth creature within 10 feet, adding its remaining hp to that creature's. The hp gained this way can exceed the normal maximum of that creature. A shoth can accept one such merger every 24 hours.

action.name: Acid Wave {@recharge 5}
entries: The droth rises up and crashes down, releasing a 20-foot-radius wave of acidic ooze. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) acid damage and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't knocked {@condition prone}.

Oth who live for centuries eventually transform into droth. These huge, undulating piles of ooze travel from world to world, creating the zolvs wherever they are needed. Droth have a calming effect on living creatures, and their rippling surface is not unlike a great body of water. Droth have a different sense of time than other shoth and communicating simple messages with them can take days or weeks. Droth are revered by the sooze and the oth, as they resemble Shoth itself. Droth, in turn, bolster the abilities of the lesser shoth.

entries.name: Made From Their Bodies
entries: The dissolving pools (zolvs) of the shoth are made from a portion of a droth. A droth who has recently created a zolv remains weakened (maximum hp halved)) for several days. For this reason, the droth are heavily guarded during and after the zolv production process.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The oth, including its equipment, can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Multiple Roles
entries: Choose either the Dripping Arcanist (Innate Spellcasting) or Paladin of Shoth trait.

trait.name: Paladin of Shoth
entries: The oth derives its power from Shoth itself, its zom shining with sacred light. Its Armor Class increases by 2. A non-shoth creature that starts its turn within 5 feet of the oth must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition blinded} by the light of Shoth until the end of its turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The oth makes two oozing slam attacks or one oozing slam and one greatsword attack.

action.name: Oozing Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage.

action.name: Greatsword (Paladin of Shoth Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Merge
entries: A shoth who has less than half its maximum hp can merge with any other shoth creature within 10 feet, adding its remaining hp to that creature's. The hp gained this way can exceed the normal maximum of that creature. A shoth can accept one such merger every 24 hours.

action.name: Spray {@recharge 6}
entries: The oth sprays acid in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Oth are soozes that have lived at least 100 years. The oth command the soozes and pilot the strange oozing ships which carry the shoth from world to world. Oths take their orders from droths and negotiate with the creatures of a world. Their magic and natural charm help them to lead a creature, people, or species to the zolvs. Oths are large humanoids with four appendages, and they wear hooded cloaks. Their zoms are stored inside their chest and pulse rhythmically like a mortal heart.

entries.name: Friendly
entries: Oths are charismatic and friendly creatures, despite their oozing appearance. They have excellent senses of humor and can get along with nearly everyone. They sincerely want what is in the best interests of their allies. However, they work tirelessly to move their allies towards being dissolved since they see it as the best way of achieving ultimate kinship for all living creatures.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The oth's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components:

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The sooze, including its equipment, can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Multiple Roles
entries: Choose either the Laborer or Warrior trait.

trait.name: Laborer
entries: The sooze is strong and tireless. It gains immunity to {@condition exhaustion} and can Dash as a bonus action 3 times each day.

trait.name: Warrior
entries: The sooze is trained and equipped as a warrior. Its Armor Class increases by 2. The sooze has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of its allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Oozing Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) acid damage.

action.name: Longsword (Warrior Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Merge
entries: A shoth who has less than half its maximum hp can merge with any other shoth creature within 10 feet, adding its remaining hp to that creature's. The hp gained this way can exceed the normal maximum of that creature. A shoth can accept one such merger every 24 hours.

The sooze make up the bulk of the shoth's armed forces. It appears vaguely humanoid with two or three appendages capable of holding weapons or tools. Its zom sits inside its head, where the strange sphere is visible through its translucent flesh.

entries.name: Unquestioning
entries: The sooze follow the instructions of the oth and droths without hesitation. They retain some of the personality traits of their former selves, but they are eager to prove themselves and embrace their status as freshly dissolved.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The sigilian can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Cognivore
entries: At the start of each of its turns if the sigilian is inside a book that is not a spellbook, it removes the words from 3 ({@dice 1d6}) pages and regains 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hp.

trait.name: Home Sweet Tome
entries: The sigilian can move half its speed to enter a book. If the book is being worn or carried by a creature, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or the sigilian enters the book. A creature can take its action to find the sigilian in a book by succeeding on a {@dc 12} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check. If successful, a creature can use a bonus action to tear out the pages where the sigilian is hiding, forcing the sigilian out of the book and into an unoccupied space within 5 feet. Alternatively, a creature can destroy the book with a successful melee attack, dealing half of the damage to the sigilian and forcing it out of the book into an unoccupied space within 5 feet.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sigilian makes three attacks. one with its cut and two with its paste.

action.name: Cut
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage and the sigilian copies one of the target's weapon attacks for 1 minute.

action.name: Paste
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. {@h}Damage die and type are determined by the copied weapon attack from Cut. Glowing runes in the image of that weapon appear as the sigilian attacks.

action.name: Devour Spell
entries: While inside a spellbook, the sigilian eats one spell of the highest level present then exits the spellbook. It chooses to either make its next Paste attack with a number of damage dice equal to the eaten spell's level or regain 3 hp per spell level. The sigilian can only eat one spell at a time and must use the devoured spell's energy before attempting to enter another spellbook. The eaten spell's entry is garbled, but the owner can repair it for half the gold and time usually spent to copy a spell. If the owner has the spell prepared, it can re-record the spell during a long rest for no additional cost.
{@i Students of magic scoff at the idea of sigilians. Living spells fleeing their tomes? Ridiculous. More likely a hazing ritual to frighten new students.}

entries.name: Born of Ink and Page
entries: More experienced mages know sigilians are no prank. Whether intentionally created or born from improperly transcribed spells, they exist. They commonly appear as swirling clouds of glowing runes.

entries.name: Hunger for Knowledge
entries: Sigilians live unseen in libraries, arcing between books, eating words, and leaving behind scrambled passages. They're most dangerous when they enter spellbooks, where they can eat inscribed spells.

entries.name: Sticks and Stones
entries: Undisturbed sigilians are docile, but the destructive nature of their hunger makes it impossible for librarians and wizards to live and let live. Left alone, they can become powerful, self-aware, intelligent sigilians that store most of the words that form them in heavy tomes similar to a lich's phylactery.

entries.name: Construct Nature
entries: A sigilian doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Nimble Feet
entries: The kapi can take the {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Prehensile Tail
entries: The kapi can use its tail to pick up or hold a small object that isn't being worn or carried. It can use its tail to interact with objects, leaving its hands free to wield weapons or carry heavier objects. The kapi can't use its tail to wield a weapon but can use it to trip an opponent (see below).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kapi makes two attacks. one with its quarterstaff and one with its tail trip.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Tail Trip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

{@i Dressed in loose-fitting clothing, this lithesome monkey-like humanoid is covered from head to toe in golden fur. He wields a quarterstaff, and his long, prehensile tail twists and turns behind him, as if imbued with a life of its own.}
A kapi's fur varies from snow white to reddish-brown with a yellowish-grey hue being the most common. Kapi from alpine forests have pale blue fur and red faces and hands.

entries.name: Jungle Homeland
entries: Kapi are a race of simian humanoids originally from tropical jungles, where they make their homes in treetop villages. Although most kapi still live in their homeland, their restless tendencies have led many of them to venture forth and explore distant lands. Kapi can be found living alongside humans and other races in villages, towns, and cities throughout the world.

entries.name: Insatiable Curiosity
entries: Kapi are intrigued by strangers and are constantly asking questions, often beyond the point where this becomes annoying. Their innate curiosity and good-hearted nature means that kapi will sometimes throw their lot in with adventurers, priests, and other wanderers. Several famous tales recount the escapades of bold and brave kapi who accompanied legendary heroes and pious monks as sidekicks and protectors.

entries.name: Playful Tricksters
entries: Kapi enjoy playing harmless pranks on others and sometimes acquire unattended items that don't belong to them, using their prehensile tails to grab small objects while no one is looking. These playful antics can often be misunderstood by humorless folk. When this happens, the kapi's ability to scamper up the nearest tree to get out of harm's way proves very handy.

entries.name: Kapi in Midgard
entries: The kapi homeland is the Kamunthalur Jungle in Khandiria, far to the southeast of the Crossroads region and east of the Red Wastes. The great kapi city of Mangchala is located in a hidden gorge deep in the rainforest. Behind a towering waterfall, hundreds of cave mouths in the cliffside lead into the underground city, where the benevolent but capricious Monkey King rules.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Monkey King fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Monkey King has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Simian Affinity
entries: The Monkey King can communicate with primates as if they shared a language. In addition, he can control primates with an Intelligence of 8 or lower that are within 120 feet of him.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Monkey King makes three golden staff attacks or two golden staff attacks and one tail attack.

action.name: Golden Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Enlightened Ray
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 12} to hit, range 100 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Great Leap
entries: The Monkey King moves up to his speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Quick Staff
entries: The Monkey King makes a golden staff attack.

legendary.name: Golden Burst (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Each creature of the Monkey King's choice within 10 feet of him must make a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Drunken Dodge
entries: When the Monkey King is hit by a weapon attack, he gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage until the end of that turn.

{@i As the hunter leveled his crossbow at the old silverback gorilla, a blur crossed his vision. An enormous monkey swung past him, striking him in the head with a ringed staff. The monkey's grin seemed both playful and terrifying.}

entries.name: Origin of the Monkey King
entries: The gods once saw the most gifted, powerful monkey ever born, and they invited him to perform for them. The monkey, being curious, found the Peaches of Immortality, and he ate as many of them as he could find. The magical fruit gave him extraordinary powers, transforming him into the Monkey King.

entries.name: Master of the Simians
entries: When the forces of civilization encroached on the lands of the simians, the Monkey King led his army of apes and monkeys against the hostile incursion of hunters and explorers. To this day, when his kind is threatened, the Monkey King appears to fight off the intruders.

entries.name: Wise Teacher
entries: The Monkey King is sought by students hoping to learn the ways of his kind. The mix of wisdom and action, of great physical ability and great peace, is passed from the Monkey King to those worthy of his teachings.

trait.name: Distract
entries: As a bonus action, the vanara can use its tail to distract an opponent within 5 feet of it by pulling on an arm, tossing dirt in the target's face, or some other method of interfering. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or have disadvantage on all attacks against the vanara until the vanara's next turn.

trait.name: Quadrupedal Dash
entries: As a bonus action, the vanara can move up to 80 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. It can't use this trait if it is wielding a weapon or holding an object weighing more than 10 lbs.

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The vanara's long jump is 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or drop its weapon in a space within 10 feet of the target.

action.name: Sling
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} om te raken, bereik 30/120 ft., één doel. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) knuppelschade.

action.name: Howl {@recharge 5}
entries: The vanara releases a sonorous howl in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, the creature takes half the damage and isn't {@condition deafened}.
{@i Wearing short pants and a colorful turban, this monkey-like creature howls a warning, its tan fur bristling.}

Quick and agile, vanara's long arms and prehensile tails are quite adept at many tasks. Their bodies are covered in fur, usually brown or black, but sometimes grey, white, or auburn. While they do bundle up in colder climates, most vanaras dress only in short pants or waist wraps and a colorful or plain white turban.

entries.name: Efficient and Supportive
entries: Vanaras are a contemplative race that dwells in forests or along coastlines. They live in tribes or clans, which are self-sufficient and have little need for trade with cities. They are quite helpful to outsiders that seek assistance, however, for they believe that good deeds towards others will be returned.

entries.name: Sentinels of the Forest
entries: Unlike their restless kapi cousins, vanaras are content with life in the forest and feel it is their duty to protect it. They communicate via rich, sonorous songs that can be heard for miles, warning those of ill intent not to tread in areas under their protection.

entries.name: Deeply Spiritual
entries: Many vanaras spend hours meditating on topics that face their tribes or lands, seeking guidance from higher powers. They regularly gather to sing in deep, booming harmony in their own form of prayer to such higher powers.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The simurg doesn't provoke an opportunity attack when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The simurg has advantage on {@skill Perception} (Wisdom) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The simurg makes three attacks. one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doelwit. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) doorborende schade.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doel. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) snijschade.

action.name: Forceful Gale {@recharge 5}
entries: The simurg beats its wings, creating wind in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) bludgeoning damage, is pushed 10 feet away from the simurg and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

{@i The titanic creature's wolf-like paws reach for the ground, as its wings whip up a cloud of dust. Its canine muzzle releases an ear-splitting howl, while an incredibly long tail of multi-hued feathers drifts lazily on the wind.}

entries.name: Benevolent Guardians
entries: Simurg are kind-hearted and protect those who dwell near them. When nesting atop a temple or sacred mountain, a simurgh often comforts and helps the local poor by healing their diseases and injuries and salving the passing of those it cannot help. After a time, the simurg flies away when too many pilgrims crowd its mountain or threaten to overwhelm a small country shrine.

entries.name: Cycle of Life
entries: When it dies, a simurg is consumed by a heatless flame and is reborn elsewhere on the same plane in a burst of light. This leads to it often being mistaken for a phoenix.

entries.name: Enmity Towards Snakes
entries: Simurg have a loathing of snakes and serpents and will attack them on sight. Even the lowliest of snakes understands this and will either hide from a simurg or be immediately hostile toward the simurg.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The simurg's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

monster.name: Clacking Skeleton
languages: Understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Horrid Clacking
entries: If the clacking skeleton moves at least 10 feet, each beast or humanoid within 30 feet of the skeleton that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The clacking skeleton makes two attacks. one with its glaive and one with its gore or two with its shortbow.

action.name: Glaive
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doel. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) doorborende schade.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

{@i Heard before it is seen, the skeleton approaches, its mismatch of bones from various humanoids clacking and clonking together with each horrid step. Leftover armor hangs from it in pieces and small horns jut half-fused from its skull.}
Augmented with necromantic power, the clacking skeleton emits the sound of grinding bone, terrifying those who hear it.

entries.name: Tomb Servitors
entries: They are often created as guardians for tombs or the lairs of necromancers from the leftover bones of apprentices, slaves, and scribes. Some believe their clacking is a form of complaint that the creatures must continue to serve their masters even after death.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A clacking skeleton doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

monster.name: Monarch Skeleton
languages: The languages it knew in life

trait.name: Master Tactician
entries: The monarch skeleton and any skeletons within 30 feet of it have advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the skeleton's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sovereign's Command
entries: As a bonus action, the monarch commands a skeleton within 30 feet of it to make one attack as a reaction against a creature the monarch attacked this round.

trait.name: Turning Defiance
entries: The monarch skeleton and any skeletons within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The monarch skeleton makes two dreadblade attacks.

action.name: Dreadblade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or its hp maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hp maximum to 0.

action.name: Grasp of the Grave {@recharge 5}
entries: Each non-skeleton creature within 30 feet of the monarch must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by ghostly, skeletal hands for 1 minute. A {@condition restrained} target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature, including the target, can take its action to break the ghostly restraints by succeeding on a {@dc 16} Strength check.
{@i An undead monarch, tight white skin clinging to its skeletal visage and a crooked oversized crown dangling precariously from the top of its skull, stares with glee at the coming battle.}

entries.name: Undead King
entries: Necromantic energy seeps from the monarch and warps the reality of the mortal world it corrupts. It brings all that appear before it to their knees in reverence. A powerful arcane necromancer could discover and unlock the ability to command armies of undead with the remains of a monarch skeleton, but such research risks madness.

entries.name: Dread Blade
entries: The blade the monarch wields is a powerful and cursed weapon when in the hands of the monarch. Infused with corruption, it slices through what remains of a mortal coil

entries.name: Ghostly Minions
entries: The monarch skeleton can call upon the greatest warriors who have fallen before to rise and hold its enemies at bay. The monarch is often accompanied by a royal guard of skeletons eager to defend their sovereign.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: The monarch skeleton doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

monster.name: Shadow Skeleton
languages: Understands the languages it knew in life but can't speak

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shadow skeleton makes two scimitar attacks.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Finger Darts
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target is surrounded by a shadowy aura for 1 minute. While surrounded by the aura, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage when hit by the scimitar attack of a shadow skeleton. Any creature can take an action to extinguish the shadow with a successful {@dc 12} Intelligence ({@skill Arcana}) check. The shadow also extinguishes if the target receives magical healing.

{@i The skeleton's ribs are filled with shadow essence, which slithers in constant motion like the writhing of eels in a carcass. The whole sight is disquieting as it moves itself with a gliding, almost liquid step.}

entries.name: Shadow Realms and Rivers
entries: Shadow skeletons are often servants to shadow river lords (see page 327) or other powerful creatures of shadow. Their writhing purple hearts generate a small amount of light—just enough to cast a shadow, never more.

entries.name: Malign Intent
entries: Unlike ordinary skeletons, shadow skeletons have been known to display some cunning and a certain depth of cruelty. They sometimes chase small living animals or fling bits of bone and shadow at birds or bats.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: The shadow skeleton doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Flare
entries: When immersed in magical darkness, a skull lantern emits a brilliant flash of light powerful enough to dispel magical darkness in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on itself, illuminating the area with bright light for {@dice 1d4} rounds. Afterwards, the light winks out and the skull falls to the ground, inert. In one week, the skull lantern has a {@chance 50|50%} chance of becoming active again, though failure to do so means it will never reanimate.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The skull lantern sheds bright light in a 20-foot-radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the skull to 0 hp, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the skull drops to 1 hp instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doelwit. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) doorborende schade.

action.name: Fire Beam {@recharge 6}
entries: The skull lantern opens its mouth, releasing a searing beam of light in a 15-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

{@i From the pile of bones, a skull rises into the air as the hood of an old cloak slips from it and drops to the floor. A baleful greenish light pours from its hollow sockets. Its jaws open wide and a rasping voice utters words in a strange tongue.}

entries.name: Accidental Animation
entries: A form of enigmatic, semi-sentient undead, a skull lantern comes into being spontaneously, soon after the destruction of another humanoid undead. It rarely lasts long, however, due to the fact that its first act is often to levitate slowly above a recently-vanquished undead creature's remains with eerie light shining from its eye sockets.

entries.name: Traces of Life
entries: Skull lanterns are given to muttering, repeating nonsense phrases, and even occasionally shouting, though what excites them to such utterings is as yet unknown; there seems to be no rhyme or reason to it. In fact, it isn't entirely clear if skull lanterns are inhabited by some spiritual remnant of their former selves or if they are occupied by some other entity altogether. Whether or not such behavior is a sign of intelligence at work, their willingness to communicate becomes more pronounced the closer they come to places of arcane power.

entries.name: Enigmatic Companions
entries: A few brave experimenters have discovered that these beings can be put to several uses. If a creature tethers a skull lantern to itself and pulls the skull along for an hour, the skull will begin floating next to the creature of its own volition; a useful trait, since the skull produces a somewhat ghastly, but steady, light. It will float along in this way until something stops it from doing so, either by attacking it, separating from it through the use of a barrier of some sort, or placing it in a container. When abandoned, a skull lantern simply floats in place where it was left and won't take up following another creature until tethered and "trained" to do so again. When attacked, a skull lantern will defend itself with its bite but otherwise will not attack.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A skull lantern doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Heroic Leap (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the sleipnir can leap into the air, gaining a flying speed of 60 feet for 1 minute.

trait.name: Trampling Charge
entries: If the sleipnir moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a rune hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the sleipnir can make another rune hooves attack against it as a bonus action.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sleipnir makes two rune hooves attacks.

action.name: Rune Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage. An undead creature who takes damage from this attack must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition restrained} by magical runes until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Gold and Ice (1/Day)
entries: The sleipnir summons a gilded avalanche in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) bludgeoning and 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage, is pushed 15 feet away from the sleipnir, and is knocked {@condition prone}. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Eight Hooves (3/Day)
entries: When a creature moves within 5 feet of the sleipnir, the sleipnir can move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

{@i These powerful horses have eight legs and variously snowy, dappled grey, or rich black coloration. Evil and cowardice are anathema to the sleipnir, and those adventurers who seek to ride them must first impress them with brave deeds and heroic songs.}

entries.name: Epic Origins
entries: The sleipnir are touched by divinity, their speed and strength the stuff of legends. They appear when great acts of courage are about to be undertaken, and they may offer temporary service in this case, acting as mounts or beasts of burden. They hauled the raw timber for the first walls of Valhalla, carried queens into war against Jotunheim, and pulled the sun to Niflheim for the lost to be found.

entries.name: Draugr Bane
entries: Sleipnir loathe the dishonorable undead and pursue them determinedly across the steppes and snowfields. Their hooves have a brilliant sheen, flashing with ensorcelling runes whenever they strike the undead. The great sleipnir matriarch, Gullfaxi, is famous for trampling an ancient vampire to death as the monster fled across an ice field.

trait.name: Foul Odor
entries: Any creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the giant sloth must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or have disadvantage on its next attack roll or ability check.

trait.name: Hunter's Dash (1/Day)
entries: The giant sloth moves double its normal speed and has advantage on all of its attacks for 1 round.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The giant sloth makes two attacks. one with its claw and one with its bite. If the giant sloth is grappling a creature, it can also use its Sloth's Embrace once.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage. The target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the sloth doesn't have another creature {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één doel. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) doorborende schade.

action.name: Sloth's Embrace
entries: The giant sloth crushes a creature it is grappling by pulling the creature against its fetid, furry chest. The target must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save is also {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.
{@i This elephant-sized beast has a pronounced snout with large canine teeth and claws like longswords. It spends most of its life slowly digesting its latest meal in its cool burrow.}

entries.name: Burrowers and Diggers
entries: The carnivorous giant sloth lives in great dirt mounds dug to its satisfaction in hilly or grassland areas. Below the mound is a series of tunnels dug for escape and the storage of recent kills.

entries.name: Hunter at the Water's Edge
entries: These clever predators bury themselves in mud and grass and wait beside rivers, lakes, and ponds for prey to draw near. Once within range, the sloth moves with surprising speed and, like a trapdoor spider, rushes out to pull its prey back into its hunting hole.

entries.name: Fetid Coats
entries: The fur of the giant sloth is a matted nightmare of mud, blood, viscera, and mold. They apply fresh coats of mud when preparing to hunt, masking their scent for a short time.

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The snow cat has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight, hearing, or smell.

trait.name: Stalker
entries: If the snow cat surprises a creature and hits it with a bite attack, the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}) if it is a Medium or smaller creature.

trait.name: Snow Camouflage
entries: The snow cat has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} om te raken, reikwijdte 5 ft., één schepsel. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) snijschade.
{@i With paws big enough to walk on top of fresh snow and senses sharp enough to hear or scent prey on windswept hills or steppes, the snow cats are superb hunters and fiercely independent.}
These panther-sized cats have the features of a lynx, including the long fur at the tips of the ears, and they can hear a snowshoe hare hopping a hundred yards away.

entries.name: Camouflage and Patience
entries: A snow cat's coat changes with the seasons and ranges from stark white to muddy brown. They are patient hunters, preferring to ambush prey from high places. Their typical prey includes everything from mice and rabbits to goats, sheep, and small pigs.

entries.name: Friends to Small Folk
entries: Gnomes and halflings have an affinity with these predatory animals, and it is common for several snow cats to serve as guards and scouts for a halfling village or a gnomish settlement. Stories of snow cats serving as mounts for small folk seem to have some truth to them, though this is rather uncommon.

entries.name: Feeding Frenzy
entries: Some snow cats enjoy working as a hunting pair or as a scout for a mountain druid or steppe ranger. However, they are extremely difficult to pull away from a kill. Once they have their teeth in something, they get very possessive and cannot be convinced to part with a carcass unless given some other food in exchange. In hills or forests, they often hide a recent kill up a tree or on a high ledge and return to it over several days to devour it all

trait.name: Night's Blood
entries: If a bite wound from the spawn of Chernobog results in an infection, the black oil that drips from the spawn's jaws seeps into the wound and vanishes. After each long rest, the creature must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On two successes, the disease is cured. On a failure, the disease progresses, forcing the creature to undergo a series of changes, in the following order.

items: The creature can't speak, and its tongue turns black.
The creature's eyes turn a deep red, and it gains darkvision 60 feet and the Sunlight Sensitivity trait.
The creature secretes black oil from its skin, and it has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.
The creature's veins turn black, slowly working their way up through the body from the appendages over 24 hours.

When the blackened veins reach its head after the final long rest, the creature experiences excruciating, stabbing pains in its temples. At sunset, the creature dies as the antlers of an elk burst from its head. The oil secreting from the corpse pools and forms a spawn of Chernobog at midnight.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the spawn of Chernobog has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spawn of Chernobog makes two attacks. one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage, and the creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become infected with the night's blood disease (see the Night's Blood trait).

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

{@i This ink-black, hulking beast looks cut from the darkness itself. It stands in the rough shape of a bear rearing up on its hind legs with slavering jaws dripping with a foul, black secretion. The antlers of a massive elk spread from either side of a pair of shining red eyes.}

entries.name: Darkness Begets Darkness
entries: The spawn of Chernobog stalk places of horror, and their presence serves as a mark of evil deeds as surely as a trail of blood at the site of a murder.

entries.name: Remnants of Malice
entries: Spawn of Chernobog come into being for a myriad of reasons, not all of which can be laid at the feet of the Black God's followers. One might appear in the wake of a particularly cruel betrayal ending in murder. A battlefield marked by merciless acts might become the hunting grounds of a spawn of Chernobog. Acts of malice, the spreading of terror; these are sacred to the Lord of the Night, and a sufficient quality or quantity of either may birth his cruel progeny.

entries.name: Indifferent Parentage
entries: As one might imagine, a god of darkness, death, and destruction makes for an indifferent parent. Chernobog cares not what end his spawn may come to. So long as they spread fear and violence, they have served their purpose.

trait.name: Cocoon Prey
entries: As a bonus action, a crypt spider can cocoon a creature within 5 feet that is currently {@condition restrained} by webbing. A cocooned creature has disadvantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape the web.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with that web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage, and the creature must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the poison damage reduces the creature to 0 hp, the creature is stable but {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour, even after regaining hp, and is {@condition paralyzed} while {@condition poisoned} in this way.

action.name: Web {@recharge 5}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. {@h}The creature is {@condition restrained} by webbing. As an action, the {@condition restrained} creature can make a {@dc 13} Strength check, escaping from the webbing on a success. The effect also ends if the webbing is destroyed. The webbing has AC 10, 5 hp, vulnerability to fire damage, and immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage.

action.name: Create Zombie
entries: The crypt spider creates a zombie from a humanoid creature it has killed with its poison. This works like the animate dead spell, except the zombie stays under the crypt spider's control for {@dice 1d4} days. At the end of this duration or when the zombie is destroyed, the corpse bursts open, releasing hundreds of crypt spider young (use swarm of spiders statistics). The crypt spider can have no more than four zombies under its control at one time.
{@i A black and red spider chitters with excitement as a nearby corpse erupts with a dozen hatchlings.}
A crypt spider is an intelligent arachnid with a red body and black abdomen. Females are distinctly larger than males.

entries.name: Graveyard Lurkers
entries: Crypt spiders make their homes in crypts, graveyards, and other locations where dead bodies are plentiful. They are blessed by dark gods of undeath, and create and control undead through power granted by the blessing.

entries.name: Horrifying Familial Bonds
entries: Crypt spiders usually gather in mated pairs with a larger female dominating a smaller male. In desperate times, males become food for crypt-spider young. Once mated, the female lays her eggs in the bodies of their prey, where the brood mature by feeding on the creatures' fluids and each other. Those that survive into adulthood "hatch" from the corpse in a horrifying display.

entries.name: Social Creatures
entries: Crypt spiders contact other crypt spiders to share unique catches, trading them like fine wines. While they can eat any creature, crypt spiders find humans, dwarves, and elves the most appetizing.

trait.name: Jumpy
entries: The spirit lamp can't be surprised and can use a bonus action to take the {@action Disengage} action.

trait.name: Lantern's Light
entries: As a bonus action, the spirit lamp can open or close its lantern. When open, the lantern sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. The spirit lamp can only see objects within the lantern's light and is blind while the lantern is closed. The lantern's light pierces magical and nonmagical darkness and can't be dispelled by magical darkness. If a creature dies in the lantern's light, its spirit is trapped in the lantern.

trait.name: Lantern Spirits
entries: Spirits of creatures that died within the lantern's light haunt it. While the lantern is open, these spirits surround the spirit lamp, slowing and attacking all creatures within the lantern's light. A creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the spirit lamp has its speed halved and must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If the spirit lamp dies and the lantern is open, the lantern's spirits continue to harm creatures within 30 feet of it until the lantern is destroyed or closed.

trait.name: Spirit Lantern
entries: The spirit lamp's lantern is immune to damage and can't be the target of spells or effects as long as the spirit lamp lives. When the spirit lamp dies, the lantern floats gently to the ground and opens, if it was closed. The lantern has AC 17, 50 hp, and is immune to piercing, poison, and psychic damage. A creature that touches the lantern must succeed on a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or be cursed. A cursed creature is {@condition frightened} of darkness, can't see anything outside of the lantern's light, and is unable to drop the lantern. The cursed creature will risk its own life to protect the lantern. A creature can repeat the saving throw each day at dawn, lifting the curse and ending the effects on itself on a success. If this occurs, the lantern disintegrates. After three failed saving throws, {@spell remove curse} or similar magic is required to end the curse.

If the creature remains cursed after 30 days, it is irreversibly changed by the curse, and it becomes the lantern's new spirit lamp. Voluntarily opening the lantern counts as a failed saving throw. If the lantern is destroyed, all captured spirits are put to rest and the cursed bearer, if it has not yet changed into a spirit lamp, is freed of the curse.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The spirit lamp makes three attacks.

action.name: Spirit Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Lantern Beam
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage.
{@i The skeletal figure draped in fine robes lifts its lantern, illuminating the area in a sickly light.}
Spirit lamps are cursed creatures carrying lanterns that trap the souls of their victims and unleash those souls to ravage the living.

entries.name: Descent Into Madness
entries: A living creature that touches the lantern is cursed, unable to release it and unable to see except in the lantern's light. Torn between fear of the darkness and the horrors it sees in the cursed light, the bearer is soon driven mad. Over time the bearer twists into the skeletal spirit lamp.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: The spirit lamp doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Storm Form
entries: The spirit can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the spirit or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) thunder damage. In addition, the spirit can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) thunder damage. Any creature which ends its turn in the same space as the spirit takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) thunder damage at the end of its turn.

action.name: Thunder Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) thunder damage.

action.name: Shocking Bolt
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) lightning damage.

action.name: Tempest {@recharge 6}
entries: Each creature within 10 feet of the spirit must succeed on a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) lightning damage, 5 ({@damage 2d4}) thunder damage, is thrown 10 feet in a random direction, and is knocked {@condition prone}.
{@i A floating figure made of crackling energy vibrates and shifts at an alarming rate. While the size of the creature is fixed, its form never seems to settle into a single shape.}

Storm spirits are primal guardians created from elemental energy. They are the manifested rage of nature come to destroy those who pollute and corrupt the land. As formless beings made of lightning and thunder, they serve a wide variety of masters, including storm lords (see page 139), elven enchanters (see page 143), and druids.

entries.name: Called by Druids
entries: Druids can tap into the wrathful side of nature by performing a ritual to summon a group of storm spirits when they feel the laws of nature have been violated. These spirits feel an affinity for druids filled with righteous anger and serve until vengeance is done.
